summary: This is an email from April 8, 2021, scheduling an evidence review for the following week at 500 Pearl Street. It lists FBI Special Agents available to assist and notes that Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team will be present. It also details that SOS will bring highly confidential evidence from CDs and Epstein's devices for review.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell, the defendant, and her defense team are scheduled to be present for an evidence review at 500 Pearl Street.

persons.name: SOS
persons.context: SOS is mentioned as the individual who will be present with a clean laptop and hard drives containing highly confidential images from CDs and Epstein's devices for the defense to review.

connections.description: SOS is responsible for providing evidence from Epstein's devices for Maxwell's defense team to review as part of the legal proceedings.

events.title: Evidence Review Session 1
events.description: Scheduled evidence review at 500 Pearl Street with FBI Special Agents, Ghislaine Maxwell, and her defense team present.

events.title: Evidence Review Session 2
events.description: Scheduled evidence review at 500 Pearl Street with FBI Special Agents, Ghislaine Maxwell, and her defense team present.

events.title: Evidence Review Session 3
events.description: Scheduled evidence review at 500 Pearl Street with FBI Special Agents, Ghislaine Maxwell, and her defense team present.

keyFacts: An evidence review was scheduled for April 13-15, 2021, at 500 Pearl Street with Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team present.
FBI Special Agents were assigned to assist with the evidence review sessions.
SOS was to bring highly confidential images from CDs previously reviewed at the MDC and from Epstein's devices that the defense had not yet seen.
The document indicates ongoing legal proceedings and evidence disclosure in the Maxwell case in April 2021.
The email originates from the FBI New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk.
